text.__SUMMARY__: Acacia hadrophylla is a shrub of the genus Acacia and the subgenus Plurinerves. It is native to an area in the southern Wheatbelt and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia.The dense spreading shrub typically grows to a height of 0.3 to 0.5 metres (1 to 2 ft). It blooms from June to September and produces yellow flowers.
